biography.value:
The earth shudders with every footfall of this massive giant.

Foes of the Gods.

Tall enough to look a titan in the eye and strong enough to wrestle a dragon, jotun giants are the lords of giantkind and the immortal enemies of the gods. Their enormous halls are carved in mountains and glaciers throughout the north. As foes of the northern gods, jotun giants plot to regain their former status as lords of creation. Many know ancient secrets and snippets of antediluvian arcane lore, and the most powerful among them straddle the line between mortal and demigod.

Contests and Challenges.

Like many giants, jotun enjoy a challenge. Only the mightiest heroes can challenge a jotun's might in physical combat, and most resort to cunning or trickery to defeat a jotun. However, jotun giants are no fools and catch on to trickery quickly.

description.value: The jotun can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three Greatclub or Rock attacks.
Melee Weapon Attack: [[/r 1d20+17]]{+17} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 28 ([[/damage 4d8 + 10 type=bludgeoning]]) damage plus 27 ([[/damage 6d8 type=cold]]) damage.
Ranged Weapon Attack: [[/r 1d20+17]]{+17} to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 32 ([[/damage 4d10 + 10 type=bludgeoning]]) damage plus 27 ([[/damage 6d8 type=cold]]) damage.

Each creature of the jotun's choice within 120 feet of the jotun and aware of it must succeed on a [[/save ability=wisdom dc=20]] saving throw or become &Reference[condition=frightened] for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the jotun's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

The jotun swings its ice-coated greatclub in a wide arc. Each creature within 20 feet of the jotun must make a [[/save ability=dexterity dc=23]] saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 36 ([[/damage 8d8 type=bludgeoning]]) damage and 54 ([[/damage 12d8 type=cold]]) damage and is pushed up to 15 feet away from the jotun and knocked &Reference[condition=prone]. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't pushed or knocked &Reference[condition=prone].
The jotun's ability scores and hp maximum can't be reduced except by means of a @spell[wish] spell.
The jotun's weapon attacks are magical. When the jotun hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra [[/damage 6d8 type=cold]] damage (included in the attack).
The jotun has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

The jotun is immune to any spell or effect that would force it to leave the Material Plane, unless the jotun wants to leave. It has disadvantage on saving throws against effects that would return it to the Material Plane from another plane of existence.
While the jotun remains motionless in nonmagical, natural terrain, it has advantage on Dexterity (&Reference[skill=Stealth]) checks.
If a rock or similar object is hurled at the jotun, the jotun can, with a successful [[/save ability=dexterity dc=10]] saving throw, catch the missile and take no bludgeoning damage from it.

Your magic and an offering put you in contact with a god or a god's servants. You ask a single question concerning a specific goal, event, or activity to occur within 7 days. The DM offers a truthful reply. The reply might be a short phrase, a cryptic rhyme, or an omen.

The spell doesn't take into account any possible circumstances that might change the outcome, such as the casting of additional spells or the loss or gain of a companion.

If you cast the spell two or more times before finishing your next long rest, there is a cumulative [[/r 1d100]]{25 percent} chance for each casting after the first that you get a random reading. The DM makes this roll in secret.

materials.value: incense and a sacrificial offering appropriate to your religion, together worth at least 25 gp, which the spell consumes

description.value:
You touch a creature, and that creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become cursed for the duration of the spell. When you cast this spell, choose the nature of the curse from the following options:

  • Choose one ability score. While cursed, the target has disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws made with that ability score.
  • While cursed, the target has disadvantage on attack rolls against you.
  • While cursed, the target must make a Wisdom saving throw at the start of each of its turns. If it fails, it wastes its action that turn doing nothing.
  • While the target is cursed, your attacks and spells deal an extra [[/damage 1d8 type=necrotic]] damage to the target.

A @spell[remove curse] spell ends this effect. At the DM's option, you may choose an alternative curse effect, but it should be no more powerful than those described above. The DM has final say on such a curse's effect.

At Higher Levels.

If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the duration is @status[concentration], up to 10 minutes. If you use a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the duration is 8 hours. If you use a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the duration is 24 hours. If you use a 9th level spell slot, the spell lasts until it is dispelled. Using a spell slot of 5th level or higher grants a duration that doesn't require @status[concentration].

A line of strong wind 60 feet long and 10 feet wide blasts from you in a direction you choose for the spell's duration. Each creature that starts its turn in the line must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed 15 feet away from you in a direction following the line.

Any creature in the line must spend 2 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves when moving closer to you.

The gust disperses gas or vapor, and it extinguishes candles, torches, and similar unprotected flames in the area. It causes protected flames, such as those of lanterns, to dance wildly and has a [[/r 1d100]]{50 percent} chance to extinguish them.

As a bonus action on each of your turns before the spell ends, you can change the direction in which the line blasts from you.

You create a seismic disturbance at a point on the ground that you can see within range. For the duration, an intense tremor rips through the ground in a 100-foot-radius circle centered on that point and shakes creatures and structures in contact with the ground in that area.

The ground in the area becomes &Reference[rule=difficultterrain]{difficult terrain}. Each creature on the ground that is @status[concentration||concentrating] must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature's @status[concentration] is broken.

When you cast this spell and at the end of each turn you spend @status[concentration||concentrating] on it, each creature on the ground in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is knocked &Reference[condition=prone].

This spell can have additional effects depending on the terrain in the area, as determined by the DM.

Fissures.

Fissures open throughout the spell's area at the start of your next turn after you cast the spell. A total of [[/r 1d6]] such fissures open in locations chosen by the DM. Each is [[/r 1d10 * 10]]{1d10 Ã— 10} feet deep, 10 feet wide, and extends from one edge of the spell's area to the opposite side. A creature standing on a spot where a fissure opens must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or fall in. A creature that successfully saves moves with the fissure's edge as it opens.

A fissure that opens beneath a structure causes it to automatically collapse (see below).

Structures.

The tremor deals 50 bludgeoning damage to any structure in contact with the ground in the area when you cast the spell and at the start of each of your turns until the spell ends. If a structure drops to 0 hit points, it collapses and potentially damages nearby creatures. A creature within half the distance of a structure's height must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes [[/damage 5d6 type=bludgeoning]] damage, is knocked &Reference[condition=prone], and is buried in the rubble, requiring a DC 20 Strength (&Reference[skill=Athletics]) check as an action to escape. The DM can adjust the DC higher or lower, depending on the nature of the rubble. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and doesn't fall &Reference[condition=prone] or become buried.

materials.value: a pinch of dirt, a piece of rock, and a lump of clay

description.value: You gain the ability to comprehend and verbally communicate with beasts for the duration. The knowledge and awareness of many beasts is limited by their intelligence, but at minimum, beasts can give you information about nearby locations and monsters, including whatever they can perceive or have perceived within the past day. You might be able to persuade a beast to perform a small favor for you, at the DM's discretion.

Spellcasting.

The jotun casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 20):

  • At will: @UUID[Actor.id9bUYiYyXy7IGJf.Item.E89uFQnBjjaieW2R], @UUID[Actor.id9bUYiYyXy7IGJf.Item.Y6xbkIQ9Qtbc95XR]

  • 3/day: @UUID[Actor.id9bUYiYyXy7IGJf.Item.yBmOMu065qoxoG5s], @UUID[Actor.id9bUYiYyXy7IGJf.Item.8AFFk2HrG7ym8CLu]

  • 1/day: @UUID[Actor.id9bUYiYyXy7IGJf.Item.lFkIQkj03qIUkrjq]
